definition: lingering fear
extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me
surname Yu
variant of 餘|余[yu2], remainder
to palpitate
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)

sentences.english: He was still frightened of the veterinary surgeons.
sentences.chinese: 他對外科獸醫一直心有餘悸。
每次餘震都讓李女士心有餘悸。

sentences.english: Plot of the film makes people shudder at.
sentences.chinese: 影片情節讓人心有餘悸。

sentences.english: Even after many years, in retrospect, still have a lingering fear.
sentences.chinese: 即使事隔多年，回想起來，仍是心有餘悸。

sentences.english: The first two or three days I was alone there still scare me.
sentences.chinese: 對剛開始孤獨一人的兩三天我至今仍心有餘悸。

sentences.english: Those who had survived were still shocked by the quake that destroyed their world.
sentences.chinese: 這場毀了他們家園的地震仍然使那些倖存者心有餘悸。

sentences.english: Long after the panic and the pain had passed, she was haunted by the experience.
sentences.chinese: 驚慌與痛苦早已過去，她仍心有餘悸。

definition: lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
to turn pale with fright (idiom)
to deride/to mock
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
red in the face/extremely angry
the State of Qǐ in modern Qǐ county 杞縣|杞县, Henan (c. 1500-445 BC), a small vassal state of Shang and Western Zhou for most of its existence
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
to cross (a road, an ocean etc)/to cut across
sullen/to scowl miserably
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
conclusion/judgment/verdict
kitchen/cook/chef
aggressive/truculent/overbearing
